Package chess.piece

Class Rook

java.lang.Object
chess.Piece
chess.piece.Rook
public class Rook
extends Piece
Rook is a subclass extending chess.Piece. It represents a Rook piece in a chess game.
Author:
Seok Yim, Mae Khaled

    • Rook

      Constructor for Rook.
      Parameters:

      cc - current column index
      color - color of the Rook

  • Method Details

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove​(int er, int ec, Piece[][] chessboard, int turn_number)
      Checks whether a specific move for a Piece is valid. Assumes the move is not repeating the current Piece location. Assumes that er and ec are between 0 and 7, inclusive on both sides.
      Specified by:
      isValidMove in class Piece
      Parameters:
      er - ending/final row index for this move
      ec - ending/final column index for this move
      chessboard - Piece[][] chessboard
      turn_number - the number of turns passed since the start of game
      Returns:
      true if is a valid move, false otherwise

    • move

      public void move​(int er, int ec)
      Moves Piece to a specific location. Assumes that the move to be made is valid ( does no condition checking).
      Overrides:
      move in class Piece
      Parameters:
      er - ending/final row index after move
      ec - ending/final column index after move

    • canReach

      public boolean canReach​(int er, int ec, Piece[][] chessboard)
      Determines whether a Piece can reach a specific location to kill an enemy if the enemy were to be there.
      Specified by:
      canReach in class Piece
      Parameters:
      er - ending row index
      ec - ending column index
      chessboard - Piece[][] chessboard
      Returns:
      true if the piece can reach the specified location to possibly kill an enemy, false otherwise

    • getAllPossibleMoves

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer[]> getAllPossibleMoves​(Piece[][] chessboard, int turn_number)
      Returns all possible moves that a specific piece is capable of making. The returned possible moves might be blocked by other pieces (so they could be considered invalid), but they are ensured to be moves within the board.
      Specified by:
      getAllPossibleMoves in class Piece
      Parameters:
      chessboard - Piece[][] chessboard
      turn_number - the number of turns passed since the start of the game
      Returns:
      the ArrayList of Integer[] of length 2 containing the row and column indices of the final location for the possible move

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides the toString method from its superclass.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a string representing piece information (color and type)
